description:
Streptomyces ambofaciens ATCC 23877 is a species of actinobacteria that belongs to the genus Streptomyces. It is a Gram-positive, aerobic, and filamentous bacterium known for its ability to produce various secondary metabolites, including the antibiotic spiramycin.

The Streptomyces ambofaciens ATCC 23877 strain was first isolated from soil samples collected in France. It is a prolific producer of antibiotics and has been the subject of extensive research due to its potential applications in the pharmaceutical industry.

Structurally, Streptomyces ambofaciens ATCC 23877 exhibits a complex life cycle, characterized by the formation of substrate mycelium and aerial hyphae. The aerial hyphae eventually differentiate into spores, which allow the bacterium to survive in unfavorable environmental conditions.

Genetically, the Streptomyces ambofaciens ATCC 23877 strain has a linear chromosome with a high guanine-cytosine (GC) content, which is a common feature of Streptomyces species. The genome of this strain has been sequenced, providing insights into the genetic mechanisms underlying its secondary metabolite production and other physiological characteristics.

Overall, Streptomyces ambofaciens ATCC 23877 is an important actinobacterial species with potential applications in the development of novel antibiotics and other pharmaceutical products.
